sentences.en: A mole can undermine the strongest rampart.
sentences.cn: 一只田鼠能毁坏最坚固的堡垒.

sentences.en: But Ehud Olmert said second - guessing would only undermine the army.
sentences.cn: 广播称,但表示猜测只会削弱军队.

sentences.en: D'Alembert has tried to undermine by various cavils.
sentences.cn: D'Alembert百般挑剔试图暗中破坏.

sentences.en: economic policies that threaten to undermine the health care system
sentences.cn: 可能会损害医疗保健制度的经济政策

sentences.en: Even a handful of persons could undermine our great undertaking.
sentences.cn: 少数人可以破坏我们的大事业.

sentences.en: How do we maintain the trust of the people if you undermine us?
sentences.cn: 如果你在暗中破坏我们怎么能保持人们对我们的信任 呢 ?

sentences.en: I don't want to do something that would undermine the chances of success.
sentences.cn: 我不想做会影响成功机会的事情。

sentences.en: Incidents like these began to undermine Angleton's credibility.
sentences.cn: 这一类事情开始损毁安格尔顿的声誉.

sentences.en: It does not, however, undermine the basic messages of the text.
sentences.cn: 然而, 这并不会损害正文基本要点.

sentences.en: Offering advice on each and every problem will undermine her feeling of being adult.
sentences.cn: 对每个问题都给出建议会令她觉得自己不像个成年人。

sentences.en: The continued fighting threatens to undermine efforts to negotiate an agreement.
sentences.cn: 持续的战斗有可能破坏通过谈判达成协议的努力。

sentences.en: The text, if adopted, would severely undermine poor countries'right to development.
sentences.cn: 文本, 如获通过, 将严重损害穷国的发展权.

sentences.en: They are trying to undermine my position.
sentences.cn: 他们在试图损伤我的地位.

sentences.en: They will do anything to undermine their adversary's reputation.
sentences.cn: 他们会不择手段地去损害对手的名誉.

sentences.en: This may help to undermine the brittle truce that currently exists.
sentences.cn: 这也许会火上浇油，破坏当前脆弱不稳的休战局面。

sentences.en: This will lower the returns to all existing sellers and perhaps undermine the prise structure altogether.
sentences.cn: 这就会降低所有现在销售者的投资收益,并且大约会损害总的价格结构.

trans.tran_cn: 逐渐削弱，使逐步减少效力，从根基处破坏，挖…的墙脚
trans.tran_en: If you undermine someone's efforts or undermine their chances of achieving something, you behave in a way that makes them less likely to succeed

trans.tran_cn: 暗中破坏； 逐渐削弱； 侵蚀…的基础
trans.tran_en: to gradually make someone or something less strong or effective
